title: Interpreting a Hubble Plot
content: The slope of a Hubble plot is known as Hubble's Constant, and the steepness of the slope corresponds with the rate of expansion of the Universe. A steeper slope indicates a faster rate of expansion.

question.label: Do your observations suggest that the Universe is getting bigger or getting smaller?
If the slope of the line for your data were steeper, would that indicate the Universe was expanding faster or slower?
